column1: Female patient, 44 years old, with remote and near negative pathological anamnesis.
He arrives in pulmonary stenosis for the onset of dyspnea, cough and hyperpyrexia.
PO2 of 59% hypocapnic hypoxemic respiratory failure; normal laboratory tests.
computed/computerized tomography scan of the chest is performed without intravenous administration of contrast medium.
Axial images, reconstruction with Lung algorithm

Multiple bilateral parenchymal thickenings, with irregular margins, some with patent air bronchogram and others with frosted glass, associated with intra- and inter-lobular septal thickening, with a prevalent peribroncovasal and subpleural distribution and with subtotal commitment of the lower lobes, in particular of the LID ; thin fibrotic streak of LIS.
Coronal reconstruction, reconstruction with Lung algorithm

Bilaterally, multiple parenchymal thickenings, some with patent air bronchogram and others with frosted glass, with a prevalent peribroncovasal and subpleural distribution and greater level of the lower lobes, in particular of the LID.
